intro: Biermannia ecalcaratus, commonly known as the sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in coastal or inland areas with well-drained conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and opposite, while its flowers are often white or pale blue in color. Biermannia ecalcaratus is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
